subject: Re: [junit] Configurable XML file in JUNIT to set different sets of values to a test method
msgSnippet: You can look at Marigold. It is an in-container testing framework. It can used both for unit and integration testing. Search for Marigold on on sourceforge.net
messageBody:
You can look at Marigold. It is an in-container
testing framework. It can used both for unit and
integration testing.

Search for Marigold on on sourceforge.net

Hope this helps

--- Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:

> imthiyas_y wrote:
> > Hi
> >
> > I'm looking for a configurable XML file in JUNIT
> to set different sets
> > of values to a test method . So that the values
> can be configurable by
> > a layman. So pl help me on this.
> >
> Here, try this:
>
>
http://twasink.net/blog/archives/2003/10/junit_and_datad.html
>
> You can easily modify the suite() method shown here
> to read the expected
> inputs and results from a file.
>
> Also, you may want to consider other tools; FIT
> seems to be gaining
> popularity for this.
>
>
> --
> "Software is too expensive to build
> cheaply"
> Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/
> robertdw@...
